intro: Didymosperma gracile, commonly known as the slender didymosperma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
